title: Employer Not Paying Salary or Wages
description: When your employer refuses to pay your salary, wages, or withholds payment without valid reason, you have legal rights to recover your dues and take action for non-payment.

rights.title: Right to Timely Payment of Wages
rights.description: Every worker has the fundamental right to receive their wages on time as agreed in their employment contract or as per legal requirements.
rights.application: Applies to all employees earning up to ₹24,000 per month. Wages must be paid before the 7th of the following month for monthly paid employees.
limitations: Only applies to employees earning below ₹24,000 per month
Does not cover contract workers in some cases

rights.title: Right to File Complaint for Non-Payment
rights.description: You can file a formal complaint with labor authorities if wages are not paid within the legal timeframe.
rights.application: File complaint within 6 months of wage being due. Authority can order payment with compensation.
examples: Filing complaint with District Labor Officer
Approaching Labor Court for wage recovery

actionSteps.title: Document Your Employment and Wage Details
actionSteps.description: Gather all employment-related documents including appointment letter, salary slips, bank statements, and any communication about wages.
documentsNeeded: Bank statements showing previous wage payments
Email or written communication about salary
warnings: Keep original documents safe - submit only photocopies for complaints

actionSteps.title: Send Written Notice to Employer
actionSteps.description: Send a formal written notice to your employer demanding payment of due wages within a reasonable time (typically 15 days).
documentsNeeded: Proof of delivery (registered post receipt or email delivery confirmation)

contacts.name: India Post
contacts.hours: Monday to Saturday 9 AM to 5 PM

actionSteps.title: File Complaint with Labor Inspector/Officer
actionSteps.description: If employer doesn't respond to notice, file formal complaint with District Labor Officer or Inspector under Payment of Wages Act.
documentsNeeded: Copy of notice sent to employer

contacts.name: District Labor Office
contacts.hours: Monday to Friday 9 AM to 5 PM

resources.title: Payment of Wages Act Complaint Form
resources.description: Official form for filing wage complaint

actionSteps.title: Attend Conciliation Proceedings
actionSteps.description: Participate in conciliation meetings arranged by labor authorities to resolve the dispute amicably.
warnings: Bring all original documents to the hearing
Consider bringing a witness if available

actionSteps.title: Approach Labor Court if Conciliation Fails
actionSteps.description: If conciliation doesn't work, the case will be referred to Labor Court where binding decision will be made.
warnings: Consider legal representation for complex cases

sources.title: The Payment of Wages Act, 1936
sources.authority: Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India
sources.excerpt: An Act to ensure the payment of wages to certain classes of persons employed in industry.
